revised_title: Exploring the Mechanism of Stretch Activation in Insect Fibrillar Flight Muscle
tldr: This article discusses the phenomenon of stretch activation in insect fibrillar flight muscles, which is responsible for the rhythmic mechanical activity during flight. The author explains how this mechanism is not accompanied by synchronous electrical events in the muscle fiber membrane and how it can provide valuable information for understanding the molecular mechanism of muscular contraction.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Muscle Physiology
